member.name: T:Sudoku.Analytics.AreaAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute type that is applied to a , indicating the enabled area that the step searcher can be invoked.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.AreaAttribute.AllowDefault
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified step searcher is allowed in default searching environment.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.AreaAttribute.AllowGathering
member.summary: Indicates whether the specified step searcher is allowed in gathering environment.

summary.para: Represents cached fields used by solving and analyzation for a sudoku puzzle, reducing repeated and redundant calculations.

All names of fields given in this type can also be found in type , but those values are defined as instant properties, which means the value will be calculated after you invoke them. For example, if we use a property of them for 5 times, the result value will be calculated for 5 times.

Sometimes, such values may only be calculated only once, and we just use those return values after the value had been calculated. For the consideration of the calculation result caching, those results will be stored here as fields, we can use them if we can ensure that such fields have already been initialized. For calling the method , we can ensure those fields are initialized, in order to be used later. In other words, you must ensure the method having been called before using such fields if you want to use them; otherwise, will be thrown for cached fields whose types are reference ones.
The reason why I defined them as fields is that they are cached values. "" means caching, and "field" means the value to be fetched without encapsulation, for a better performace.
Some s may rely on this type.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Buffers.CachedCellMaps.EmptyCells
member.remarks: This map should be used after called, and you'd better not use this field on instances which are marked the attribute .

member.name: T:Sudoku.Analytics.Categorization.Technique
member.summary: Represents a technique instance, which is used for comparison.

b.i: Please note that some fields declared in this type may not be used by neither direct reference nor reflection, but they are reserved ones. In the future I'll implement the searching logic on those fields (maybe?)

member.name: T:Sudoku.Analytics.Compatibility.HodokuLibraryCompatiblity
member.summary: Represents some methods that are used for get the details supported and defined by another program called Hodoku.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Analytics.Compatibility.HodokuLibraryCompatiblity.GetAliases(Sudoku.Analytics.Categorization.Technique)
member.summary: Gets all possible aliased names that are defined by Hodoku.
member.returns: The array of aliased names, or if it is not defined by Hodoku.
member.exception: Throws when the specified value is not defined by the type , or the value is .

member.name: M:Sudoku.Analytics.Compatibility.HodokuLibraryCompatiblity.GetHodokuPrefix(Sudoku.Analytics.Categorization.Technique)
member.summary: Try to get the prefix of the specified technique. The return value will be a four-digit value represented as a value. For more information please visit this link.

returns.para: A value using a four-digit value to describe a technique used in a sudoku grid, which is defined by the project Hodoku.
If this technique is not supported by Hodoku, will be returned.

remarks.para: Please note that some technique fields are separated into multiple sub-types, but they all belong to a same type of a technique supported by Hodoku. For example, and are supported by Hodoku as one technique "Sue de Coq", so if you get the prefix from the two fields, the return value are same (i.e. the value "1101").

member.exception: Throws when the specified value is not defined by the type , or the value is .

member.name: M:Sudoku.Analytics.Compatibility.HodokuLibraryCompatiblity.GetDifficultyRating(Sudoku.Analytics.Categorization.Technique,System.Nullable{Sudoku.Compatibility.Hodoku.HodokuDifficultyLevel}@)
member.summary: Try to get difficulty rating of the specified technique.
member.param: The difficulty level that is defined by Hodoku.

returns.para: An value defined by the project Hodoku.
If this technique is not supported by Hodoku, will be returned.

member.exception: Throws when the specified value is not defined by the type , or the value is .

member.name: M:Sudoku.Analytics.LogicalAnalysisContext.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step},Sudoku.Concepts.Grid@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a instance via the specified.
member.param: Indicates whether the step searcher only find one possible step and exit.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.LogicalAnalysisContext.OnlyFindOne
member.summary: Indicates whether the solver only find one possible step and exit the searcher.

para.para: The accumulator to store each step.

summary.para: If is set to , this argument will become useless because we only finding one step is okay, so we may not use the accumulator to store all possible steps, in order to optimize the performance. Therefore, this argument can be in this case.
Provides with the type that contains a module initializer method, called automatically by the CLR (Common Language Runtime) to initialize some values.

para.i: The type is called by the compiler and the CLR (Common Language Runtime), which means you cannot use any members in this type manually.

target.name: method
target.summary: Called by the runtime automatically while booting on this solution to initialize the values, data members or any other things that can or should be initialized here.
target.remarks: The concept module is different with assembly. The solution can contain multiple assemblies, while each assembly can contain multiple modules. However, due to the design of Visual Studio project file system, each assembly will only contain one module by default.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames
member.summary: Represents with kinds of the phased difficulty rating that is used for the calculations the total rating of a step.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Size
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the size. This field is used for sized techniques, such as deadly patterns of type 3, naked or hidden subsets, fishes.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.ExtraDigit
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the extra digit. This field is used for deadly patterns of type 2.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Sashimi
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the sashimi. This field is only used for fishes.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.FishShape
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the fish shape. This field is only used for complex fishes.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Hidden
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the hidden. This field is used for some techniques that has hidden views.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Locked
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the locked. This field is only used for naked subsets.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.LockedDigit
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the locked digit. This field is only used for Locked Qiu's Deadly Pattern.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Length
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the length. This field is used for variable-length chaining techniques.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.ConjugatePair
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the conjugate pair. This field is used for deadly patterns of type 4, or advanced Unique Rectangle techniques.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Guardian
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the guardian. This field is used for some guardian-related techniques, such as guardian itself, Unique Rectangle + Guardian (i.e. Unique Rectangle External Types).

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Petals
member.summary: Indicates the number of petals used in death blossom.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.ValueCell
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the value cell used in the pattern. This field is used for Almost Locked Candidates.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Incompleteness
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the incompleteness. This field is used for Unique Rectangle incomplete types.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Avoidable
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the avoidable. This field is used for avoidable rectangles.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.WingSize
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the wing size. This field is used for Unique Rectangle + Wings, or Regular Wing technique itself.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Isolated
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the isolated digits. This field is used for Sue de Coq variant types, or Unique Rectangle + Sue de Coq.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Cannibalism
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the cannibalism. This field is used for Sue de Coq variant types.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.Mirror
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the mirror eliminations. This field is only used for exocets.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.BiBiPattern
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the Bi-Bi pattern eliminations. This field is only used for exocets.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.TargetPair
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the target pair eliminations. This field is only used for exocets.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.GeneralizedSwordfish
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the generalized swordfish eliminations. This field is only used for exocets.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Analytics.Rating.ExtraDifficultyCaseNames.ExtraHouse
member.summary: Indicates the kind is the extra house. This field is only used for complex senior exocets.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Analytics.StepSearchers.StepSearcher.GetAllUnsafe(Sudoku.Analytics.LogicalAnalysisContext@)
member.summary: Try to search for results for the current technique rule.

param.name: context
param.para: The analysis context. This argument offers you some elementary data configured or assigned, for the current loop of step searching.

member.returns:
Returns the first found step. The nullability of the return value are as belows:
:
.OnlyFindOne == .
.OnlyFindOne == , but nothing found.
Not :
.OnlyFindOne == , and found at least one step. In this case the return value is the first found step.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step
member.summary: Provides with a logical solving step that is a technique usage, and contains the conclusions.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step.#ctor(Sudoku.Solving.Conclusion[],Sudoku.Presentation.View[])
member.summary: Provides with a logical solving step that is a technique usage, and contains the conclusions.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step.Name
member.summary: Indicates the technique name. The technique name are all stored in the resource dictionary, you can find them in the Resources folder (Type ).
member.exception: Throws when the specified resource key is not found.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step.Format
member.summary: Gets the format of the current instance.
member.returns: Returns a result. If the resource dictionary doesn't contain any valid formats here, the result value will be .

remarks.para: A format is the better way to format the result text of this technique information instance. It'll be represented by the normal characters and the placeholders, e.g. "Cells {0}, with digits {1}"
Here the placeholder {0}, and {1} must be provided by property . You should create 2 values that can be replaced with the placeholder {0} and {1}.

member.exception: Throws when the specified resource key is not found.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step.BaseDifficulty
member.summary: Indicates the difficulty of this technique step.
member.remarks: Generally this property holds the default and basic difficulty of the step. If the step's difficulty rating requires multiple factors, this property will provide with a basic difficulty value as elementary and default rating value; other factors will be given in the other property .

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step.Difficulty
member.summary: Indicates the total difficulty of the technique step. This value is the total sum of merged result from two properties and . For property , the result is to sum all values up of inner property .

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step.Code
member.summary: The technique code of this instance used for comparison (e.g. search for specified puzzle that contains this technique).

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step.Group
member.summary: The technique group that this technique instance belongs to.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step.DifficultyLevel
member.summary: The difficulty level of this step.
member.remarks: Although the type of this property is marked , we still can't set multiple flag values into the result. The flags are filtered during generating puzzles.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step.ExtraDifficultyCases
member.summary: Indicates the extra difficulty cases of the technique step. If the step does not contain such cases, this property will keep value.

member.name: P:Sudoku.Analytics.Steps.Step.FormatInterpolatedParts
member.summary: Indicates the interpolated parts that is used for the format. The formats will be interpolated into the property result.

remarks.para: This property use a dictionary to merge globalizational format data. The key type is , which can be used for the comparison of the current culture via type , for example, "zh" and "en-US".
For more backing implementation details, please visit method in derived es.
